content.description: Start around the corner to the right where the horizontal crack is still wide.  Traverse left then when the crack ends big move up to top out.  Not sure about the grade did in sneakers which felt maybe V2.  Awesome looking addition that I could not do with sneakers but looks pretty classic. Will add image, but start far right in the seam.  Looks like some ok feet.  Traverse left into the easier section.  Looked to be V4-5
content.protection: Getting down is a bit of a move, I used the hueco just left of where you exit the crack and top out.
content.location: A bit down the trail (North) of Pamola Peak on Keep Ridge.  If walking down hill direction will see a big boulder on the right of trail. 45°54'39.2"N 68°54'23.4"W

content.description: Begin left, traverse across right on good holds and bad feet. Go up to the horn and either top out on the mossy side or bail out on the tree, making the v2-3 difference.
content.location: Park in the little spot for elbow pond. walk along the main car road up the hill after the parking spot, it's on your right. Only park in the elbow pond spot or the rangers will nicely chew you out about it.

content.description: Sit start, move left to the good crimp, mild dyno to the good ledge, easy top-out.
content.protection: one pad is plenty, could go no pad with a trusty spotter.
content.location: On the left side of the trail to South Turner Mt. in the flat part after Sandy Stream pond but before the serious elevation gain.

pathTokens: j. The Maine Highlands (inc. BSP / Katahdin )

content.description: The bouldering areas in, and around, Katahdin/Baxter State Park are located under this AREA.
